CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 14+4-3-d;Not necessary to examine P1-1;Costs and expenses award - domestic proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG Mr PERSON , a NORP national who was born in DATE , lives at GPE , in LOC .

On DATE the relevant municipal authorities required him to pay a fire service levy ( Feuerwehrabgabe ) of MONEY ( DM ) for DATE . This decision was based on LAW of ORG , as amended on DATE ( GPE , see paragraph CARDINAL below LAW " ) and on the municipal decree ( ORG ) of DATE ; it stated that all male adults residing in GPE at the beginning of the budget year ( DATE ) were liable to pay the contribution in question .

CARDINAL . ORG The applicant regarded this decision as contrary , inter alia , to the constitutional principle of equality before the law ( LAW ) and he appealed against it . The administrative authority ( PERSON ) of the district of GPE ( GPE ) rejected this appeal on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG ( Verwaltungsgericht ) , which dismissed his appeal on DATE . Referring to the case - law of ORG ( Bundesverfassungsgericht ) and to that of ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) of the Land , it ruled that the obligation for men , and not women , to serve in the fire brigade or to make a financial contribution was compatible with LAW .
CARDINAL . The Administrative Appeals Court dismissed the appeal which PERSON had filed against the decision of ORG ; it refused him leave to appeal on points of law .

It pointed out that like ORG it had always held the legislation requiring only the male residents of a municipality to pay a fire service levy to be consistent with LAW . The applicant ’s arguments could not persuade it to reconsider its case - law or to refer the question to ORG again . There were no new facts to present to ORG and there had not been a fundamental change in legal opinion on the subject . ORG stated that it endorsed the opinion expressed in ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE to the effect that , in view of the risks inherent in service in the fire brigade , there remained objective reasons for imposing the obligation on men but not on women .

CARDINAL . ORG The applicant challenged this judgment , which had been delivered on CARDINAL DATE , in so far as it had refused him leave to appeal on points of law , but ORG ( ORG ) dismissed his appeal on DATE .

In its view , the case raised no issue of principle ( grundlegende GPE ) . On the question whether the imposition of a fire service levy was in breach of the LAW , it concluded that it was not , in conformity with a judgment of ORG of DATE . It would only be possible to refer the matter once again to ORG if there were new facts or a fundamental change in legal opinion . However , ORG had found no evidence of this .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Mr PERSON applied finally to ORG , which on DATE , sitting as a panel of CARDINAL members , declined to accept the appeal for adjudication , on the ground that it did not have sufficient prospects of success . It noted , inter alia :

ORG has already held , in its judgment of CARDINAL DATE ... , concerning the provision which corresponds to the present section CARDINAL para . In subsequent decisions delivered ... on DATE ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , CARDINAL DATE ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , CARDINAL DATE ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , DATE ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) and DATE ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , it stated that from the point of view of Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW [ enshrining the principle of sexual equality ] there had still been no general change in legal opinion ; the fact that the obligation to serve in the fire brigade was limited to the male residents of a municipality still continued to be objectively justified on account of the risks inherent in service in the fire brigade , even though some fire brigade duties were performed by women and recently fire brigades for female volunteers had even been set up .

Nor does the fact that the Länder of Lower Saxony ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of ORG ) and the GPE - Palatinate ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the Rhineland- FAC ) make provision for an obligation to serve in the fire brigades regardless of sex constitute a reason for departing from this case - law . The sole decisive factor is that there remain DATE objective reasons ( Anknüpfungspunkte ) on the basis of which the legislature is entitled to treat men and women differently in this regard . That does not mean that there is an obligation to enact regulations differentiating between the sexes .

CARDINAL . ORG The Baden - FAC dates from DATE ; it has been amended on several occasions , most recently on CARDINAL DATE . At the time of the events in the present case the LAW was applicable as amended on DATE .

CARDINAL . The Act requires municipalities to set up proficient fire brigades which may be composed of volunteers or professionals ( sections CARDINAL para . CARDINAL and CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . Their role is to deal with , among other things , fires , natural disasters and collapsed buildings , but they may also be required to ensure safety in theatres , at meetings and exhibitions and also at markets ( section CARDINAL paras . CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . All the male residents of the municipality DATE CARDINAL inclusive may be required to serve as firemen , unless they can show that they are unfit to do so on health grounds ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . If there are insufficient volunteers , the municipalities may call upon these residents to serve ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) , but so far this has never occurred in GPE .
As the LAW does not recognise a right to active service , the municipalities may refuse to accept a volunteer ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The municipalities may adopt decrees making provision for a fire service levy of CARDINAL DM ; the resulting funds may only be used to meet the needs of the fire brigade ( section CARDINAL paras . CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .

Anyone who is liable for fire service duty ( section CARDINAL ) and who resides in the municipality at the beginning of the budget year , may be required to pay this levy ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . Certain persons are , however , exempted , such as the members of the municipal fire brigade ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The system operated in GPE was challenged upon the entry into force of the LAW on DATE . On DATE ORG ruled that the fire service levy was compatible with LAW and in particular with the general principle of equality before the law in so far as it constituted a " compensatory charge " ( PERSON ) deriving directly from the obligation to serve .

ORG In CARDINAL of the CARDINAL ORG GPE - including GPE , the residents of municipalities are required by law to perform active service in the fire brigade if there are insufficient volunteers .
